title: Why Ethiopian farmers choose Khat over coffee
text:
Why Ethiopian farmers choose Khat over coffee Friday, May 11, 2018 - 01:36
Coffee farmers in Ethiopia say climate change and low prices have made it difficult for them to depend on coffee in recent years and as a result many of them in the southern Oromia region are turning to khat instead. As Sonia Legg reports, the narcotic - a flowering plant, native to east Africa - is illegal to chew in many countries but not in the Horn of Africa, where it is an increasingly profitable option for farmers. â–² Hide
